problem_text: Find the volume of the solid obtained by rotating the region in Example 4 about the line $y=2$.
solution:
The solid and a cross-section are shown in Figure 9. Again the cross-section is a washer, but this time the inner radius is $2-x$ and the outer radius is $2-x^2$.

The cross-sectional area is
$$
A(x)=\pi\left(2-x^2\right)^2-\pi(2-x)^2
$$
and so the volume of $S$ is
$$
\begin{aligned}
V & =\int_0^1 A(x) d x \\
& =\pi \int_0^1\left[\left(2-x^2\right)^2-(2-x)^2\right] d x \\
& =\pi \int_0^1\left(x^4-5 x^2+4 x\right) d x \\
& =\pi\left[\frac{x^5}{5}-5 \frac{x^3}{3}+4 \frac{x^2}{2}\right]_0^1 \\
& =\frac{8 \pi}{15}
\end{aligned}
